content: Good followup piece, Scott. The short answer to your basic question is that Google offered the world a huge gift much greater in power than the small benefit they would receive back for it. And like many good things in life this act of goodness was spoiled by a small number of people who wanted more. In this case the Authors Guild. The Guild is made up of a few best-selling authors who didn’t need the exposure to their work that the million other non-best-selling authors craved — and that Google Book Search would have given them. A few successful authors killed the project through litigation even though they ultimately were proven to be misguided. Everyone lost a gift that almost was.
